job_title: Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) in Whittier, CA
pros: What I like about working here is the flexibility on the schedule and an emphasis on team work. Everyone is really nice and helpful. Management has an open door policy. If your part time and not assigned to a unit you will be floating around every shift. Which in some ways is good because you get different types of experiences. Benefits are great. PIH pays for your medical insurance if you choose to get care through there hospitals to add another person it’s about 40 bucks more to your insurance.
cons: What I don’t like about working here is the 10 hour shifts. This can be very tiring when your working 4 days straight and you have a heavy patient care floor. Wages go based on your years of experience. For new LVNS coming out of school your looking at 22.50 starting 1-3 years 25.00 an hour. If you work nights you get a 4 dollar diff plus your hourly.

review_title: sneaky company to work for, don't do it.
pros: coworkers were really friendly and helped in every way they can
cons:
Company told me my start rate would be $17.50, and said I would be getting paid a shift differential of $18.50; in which I was never compensated. I was getting paid the minimum at $16.00 in the ER during the peak of COVID. I was constantly scheduled to work 9-11 days straight. The beginning of their work week starts on Sunday, so on paper it looks like your days are separated; when in reality your working 9-11 days straight with no day off. For example: I was scheduled to work August 7th-August 13th; August 14th-17th. So that is 11 days straight, so because their work week starts on Sunday it looks like the days aren't 11 consecutive days. And I would only be off for one day. 
Even the nurses that worked there said they wouldn't get paid overtime when they stayed over their shift. This company is very sneaky and gets away with many things. I wouldn't work here ever again.

job_title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist in Whittier, CA
pros:
A great place to start your career as CLS. The clinical laboratory is big and well organized. All the sections are next to each other. You normally rotate 2-3 sections of clinical laboratory. In each section, you will get a good training. 

The director and administrative team are very supportive. Coworkers are very friendly and often help each other. You will learn a lot which you might not learn in small hospitals.

The hospital environment is nice and the pay is above the average.
cons: Because of its big size, you could not rotate or work in all the sections of clinical lab although you are CLS generalist.

review_title: Tread carefully, nothing is as it seems
pros: Family like environment at the Downey campus (not with management but with peers). They’ve done alot of construction so it’s not such a dump anymore, but still has a long way to go. Benefits are so-so, not the best but not the worst.
cons: Terrible upper management. High turnover of good management but they keep the trash. All C-level executives & the entire HR Dept at Downey are very corrupt. I mean like mafia-style corruption. The President is oblivious and/or looks the other way, very spineless, has alot of “yes men” around him. Bad pay, not regionally competitive so high turnover of medical staff. Lots of politics, lots of random changes within the organization. They do layoffs 2x/year. Surveyors are on site constantly because of all the patient complaints reported. Absolutely NO work life balance, they discriminate against you if you are a woman of child-bearing age and/or have children. Just read the Yelp reviews, Downey is a 2 star hospital for good reason.

Hospital hired from outside and then our good boss stepped down.. don't know the details, but from my vantage point they did her wrong. So con would be they don't grow from within. Core values on paper are not the same in practice. This impacts the culture.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Whittier, CA
pros: Good benefits. Generous PTO. Great surgeons. Large hospital with a lot of patients. Main OR does all types of surgeries so great opportunity for learning and to get experience. 8 hour and 12 hour shifts available, both day and night. Management works well with managing employee schedules and vacations. Not a lot of call during the week. Usually work only 1 weekend every 4-6 weeks. Salaries are getting better with many market adjustments in the past 5 years. Still not the best for the amount of work and type of surgeries but it is improving.
cons: Excess turnover of staff in the past several years. A lot of new circulators and scrubbers. Very busy and stressful weekend shifts with very little leadership. A revolving door of Directors, 5 in 10 years to be exact. Poor management of excessive tardies and sick calls. Staffing issues. Experienced circulators and scrubbers will do all of the heavy lifting and hard cases. Low call pay. Poor management of OR schedule, with very heavy busy days and very slow days. Management expects you to stay when they over book the OR but will turn around and send you home the very next day when the OR is slow. Overall not happy with the way the hospital managed the pandemic. They took away hours in the first shut down, with little options to get paid. There was no support with EDD benefits. A lot of employees lost all of their PTO trying to survive the shut downs. Poor overall hospital moral. Poor overall moral in the OR. Management finds temporary or short term fixes to major problems. Management doesn't fix problems quickly and effectively. Some very bad attitudes, in older staff, who cause drama and think they run the place. OR equipment and instruments are out dated or old technology. It takes years for new surgeons to get the supplies and instruments they need to advance the OR and provide better patient care. Overall the hospital is cheap. The quality of our supplies and equipment has gone down drastically in the past 3 years.

pros: I feel like PIH genuinely cares about it’s employees. There are some staffing problems, but we’re always well-stocked with PPE and supplies and the pay is competitive. This isn’t one of those places where “nurses eat their young” either. Learning and asking questions is encouraged.
cons: We need more staff! Understaffing is a huge problem and so we are overworked.

job_title: Physical Therapist/Rehab Manager in Long Beach, CA
pros: Personal relationships with my coworkers
cons: Upward mobility as a manager

pros: CNO wants to make changes. PIH making attempts at new equipment and remodeling.
cons: PIH Downey must raise the RN WAGES or we will continue to bleed out! ED has almost 50% travelers and can't seem to hire experienced staff or nurses that will stay. New RNs in ED not dedicated to nursing, team, their job or the hospital; are leaving for higher wages. Now PIH is allowing contracted doctors group in ED to dictate how department is run. Blaming staff for long wait times, when actually triage nurse can take less than 7 mins and then patient has to wait for mid-level providers to finish, then see and discharge. Simple sore throat can take 2-3 hours in the ED- too long. Radiology reading really slow-another delay. Admitting doctor and residents not calling back or delay of admission order-more delays. This has nothing to do with nursing, this is doctors and PIH doing nothing about doctor delays. PIH can't hire more nurses or keep them because they won't pay higher wages and keep raising cost of benefits or getting less. Never see COO of Downey, never makes rounds and staff have no idea what she looks like. Too many admin positions and not enough staff.

pros: pay rate, nice dept directers
cons: lack of teamwork and staff

pros: I have been a part of PIH for 13 years and work in the Wells Building. I have worked at many different positions, it is a great place to learn and gain experience, doctors are great and nurses are easy to get along with and a joy to work with.
cons: On the other hand, management and supervision skills are not up to par. They keep hiring new staff with no skills and keep messing with employees and their work patterns, making the work flow very slow and the work environment worse. Why change something that has been producing positive numbers, although some minor changes would be welcomed, and should be tested but not in such a drastic manner and complete change. Be for warned, there are supervisors who will have some employees as their favorite pets and spy's, and will discuss with them other employees issues behind their backs That is so unprofessional and I believe it violates the employees rights.

pros: Great company name, nice hospital, good cafeteria food.
cons:
Up until now, I’ve been a nurse for 4 years. From a nurse’s standpoint, never in my life have I witnessed such bad patient customer service and bedside manner. Working there for only short while, I’ve experienced nurse bullying (which is a real thing), isolation, extra hard work due to lack of teamwork, and poor attitudes by the other nurses and supervisors. I now work for a smaller, not so well-advertised hospital, enjoying every minute of this locations camaraderie and team effort.

Straight up call her name out haha

My preceptor, “M”  is nothing short of demeaning. I understand my position of having to learn from her, but it felt more like a dictatorship. I’m a seasoned nurse, but I can adapt well to any situation and am open to constructive criticism but she would not allow for such growth. Only
Her way was allowed, which wasn’t even PIH protocol but her way of poor bedside manner and extra patient load due to laziness and a superiority complex.

pros: Have a lot of freedom and not too strict of management
cons: Can get boring if you are not given work

pros: Very nice staff and have freedom
cons: Can be very boring, without much to do

job_title: Senior Contract Analyst in Whittier, CA

job_title: Covid-19 Contact Tracer in Boston, MA

cons: Training is a little confusing

pros: PIH uses electronic medical records and has a main data depository (Midas+) for, among many things, reporting to TJC and CMS.
cons: There are too many systems that do not communicate with each other. Data is often difficult to obtain as a result. Need to maximize the Midas+ system. Also, there is a culture of cronyism among senior management, favoritism, and cliques that should be eliminated. Communication at every level is one of the weakest areas.

pros: Small hospital, fast paced work environment
cons: Horrible management and no structure

job_title: Linux Systems Administrator in New York, NY
pros: Everything was pretty great, have no complaints about the job.
cons: No Complaints about the job

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Whittier, CA
pros: There was good nursing staff
cons: There was an okay management

job_title: Regsistered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: This place takes care of their patients.
cons: doent not take care of their staff.

review_title: Former specialist..run, it's a sinking ship!
pros: Great people that share your vision for health.  Opportunities to network and volunteer with other departments.
cons:
Benefits are standard, nothing amazing. Not a lot of room to grow. Be careful what department you go into. If it's not clinical you will more than likely be forced to use your accumulated PTO for forced closures. This doesnt include sick, vacation and holiday time off.  If you're not clinical you have to stress about layoffs. High staff turnover. Too bad they did not get rid of incompetent staff during recent layoffs. 
No reference policy (can be a problem, just depends)

job_title: Processing Lab Clerk in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Great first step to further career
cons: No cons about PIH Hospital

review_title: Good place to get experience but no real incentive to stay long term.
job_title: Executive Director Registered Nurse in Whittier, CA
pros: Honestly the people I work with are really the only reason I'm still here, they make night shift enjoyable and are a great team to have in difficult situations.
cons: Never really feel supported on night shift by management. No coffee or gift shop on the weekend for night shift cause the hours are shorter. They also switched benefits, it's now an HMO rather than PPO but we are paying the same amount for less. Pay is less than other hospitals, no dedicated vacation time everything comes from PTO which is also what they use for sick calls. Good luck getting your vacation request approved, it can be a rare event.

job_title: ER Financial Counselor in Whittier, CA
pros: Salary, cafeteria perks, and benefits.
cons: Toxic Work Environment. Highky discriminative especially towards disabled employees. Rude, negative towards employees work and job performance

review_title: Finally an Employee After Working at PIH Health for Years
pros: I joined PIH Health in a new full time role after having worked as a contractor for nearly four years.  When the opportunity presented itself, it was an easy choice for me.  I've had the pleasure of working with dozens of PIH Health employees at all levels on numerous projects through the years.  There is a common theme that bonds all team members: put patients first.  This vision is carried out in everything PIH Health does.  I've seen first hand the improvement in the facility itself, the push to improve critical services, and the growth of the hospital itself including the acquisition of Downey Regional Medical Center and the opening of numerous new clinics.  At the end of the day though, PIH Health is a great place to work because everyday is challenging and different, yet there are a lot of "A" players supporting you to help you overcome whatever obstacles may be hindering your success.
cons: While there is a ton of opportunity at PIH Health, there are not always a lot of open positions.  Job applicants need to be persistent.  However, waiting for the right opportunity is worth it.

review_title: Great place to gain experience and move on..
pros:
- Great people to work with, overall has a good culture 
- Patient-centered care
- Good place for new grads, competitive new grad pay; hires new grads often. (pay/benefit is not competitive enough to attract experienced staff)
- Overall a good hospital that I would trust my friend/family to come here if they ever need to be hospitalized.
cons:
- The overall benefit can be better. 
- Don't offer crosstraining programs between units, the only way to be trained is if you transfer.  Lack of learning opportunities.
- High turn over rate.
- Doesn't care to retain experienced staff.

pros: great location, coworkers, and environment
cons: low pay and very busy

job_title: RN Clinical Director in Whittier, CA
pros: PIH is a great culture to work in. Employees voices are heard and solicited by Administration in order to ensure we are always carrying out the best care for our patients. There is opportunity for growth. I have worked here 21 years and have 5 different jobs here which have given me the ability to learn, grow, and challenge my practice. The environment is clean and the people are always friendly. I love coming to work and cannot imagine working anywhere else.
cons: It is such an enjoyable place to work that one can easily get caught up in their day or a project and find that they have spent too much time here. It is important that you set personal limits in order to maintain work life balance. Maintaining this balance however supported by Administration and our Care Model.

pros: Stability. A place you can be long term. Expanding. Contrary to other reviews that report opportunities are scarce, the simple fact they continue to add wings/buildings is enough to refute that.
cons: Pay is subpar with the remainder of the industry. Benefits as of 2015 are giving employees reason to hop on Glassdoor to see what else is out there. Benefits that were once fantastic have become expensive ....in 2013, it was $0 for office visits .... Today a whopping $40. Overall compensations to include pensions have become subpar. ... Yet they continue to pour millions into new buildings.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Whittier, CA
pros:
Pay has become more competitive.
Decent-ish 403b plan, with automatic enrollment for eligible employees.
Well stocked supplies and necessary equipment.
Many rooms have built in ceiling lifts for patient repositioning.
Opportunities for growing/moving withing hospital.
Paid time for BLS/ACLS classes offered in-house.
Limited tuition reimbursement for staff ($1000/yr for part-time, $2000/yr for full-time)
cons:
PIH Whittier had a lot of turnover due to previously poor pay for RNs. This might be getting better...
Disorganized precepting/training for new grads and transfers.
Lack of "Clinical Ladder" or other award program to recognize staff who go above and beyond. No bonus for certification, specialty pay, etc.
*Note: It has been communicated that PIH will be taking part in the such ventures in the future - but that remains to be seen.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Whittier, CA
pros: Night staff work together as family. Close knit and our charge nurses give it all they've got.
cons: This hospital is a self proclaimed not for profit organization yet their business decisions and choices are borderline abusive when it comes to its employees. Young RNs will jump at the opportunity to work here but quickly find out that all this place cares about is numbers and the customer experience. They don't care about staff safety. They make staff feel like crap for overtime hours and don't provide breaks like they should. They doctor paper trails to make it look as if staff have taken proper breaks and their auditing is a complete joke and a farce.

pros: None- the managers stick together that is called a mafia - it's there way or like the director said you don't like it get out
cons:
Was advised in a meeting let the past be the past move on, it's hard to move on when the same old supervisors and managers that were part of the old problem are still employees and has unethical and unprofessional behavior. Then we proceeded to get lectured about perception vs fact and don't gossip and if we have nothing nice to say don't say anything at all and 2 breaths later the same manager degrades all the "long time" employees saying we ruin the work environment for the new employees- well the director must agree she didn't say anything about a manager bashing the long time employees - they say there is communication however there is none!! There is no respect its there way or get out!!! Managers and supervisors do nothing but lie lie lie - most unmoral, unethical and unprofessional place to work

Most not all of the new employees spend most there day on there cell phones, come in late, ask questions day after day vs writing it down and learning there job !!!!

pros: Your fellow new grads will be compassionate to you because they are suffering in the same way
cons: In the interview process, I asked how long the preceptorship lasted and what would happen if I felt I needed more time. The nurse manager said they would give me more shifts to make sure I was ready. The truth is that you have a maximum of 18 shifts and that's it. They began putting pressure on during the 5 shift on the floor.  Also, the preceptors are untrained. The first one I had for 2 weeks was an excellent nurse of 2 years herself-used the skills checklist to fairly evaluate my skills, grade me, discuss. The 2nd and 3rd preceptors never referred to the preceptee skills checklist again-just a continual flood of criticism. Very unprofessisonal and unsupportive environment. The entire staff was comprised almost entirely of new grads.

pros: Warm welcomes throughout the hospital, employees often stopping to ask if you need help, beautiful facility, unlimited growth opportunities, PIH Health university onsite, strong employee pride and an unbelievable reputation in the community. Executives are very transparent, innovative and strive to come up with ways to help grow the organization even through the most difficult healthcare challenges ever faced. Cafeteria is amazing and so is the Starbucks like coffee shop on the main floor. They recently opened a park for employees, patients and families to enjoy.  Amazing family practice doctors and specialist that squeeze you in if it's an emergency.  Benefits are fantastic, great wellness program and lots of discounts. One of the top volunteer programs but not a surprise since volunteers were the foundation of this organization.
cons: The only thing I can think of is more conference room space.

review_title: Okay first job - New Grad RN
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Whittier, CA
pros: The individuals I work with are generally very helpful, and the charge nurses on my unit are supportive to the extent their time allows. The charge RN is not usually assigned any patients, so they can help and manage the floor better.
cons: Everyone will get 2% salary increase per year - regardless of merit, effort, time with PIH. Also, PIH cut a lot of benefits before I started. No pension, pretty weak 403b contribution matching.

job_title: Medical Assistant in La Mirada, CA
pros: benefits are ok, they were better a few years ago.  insurance premium keeps going up every year, you get dental, vision, medical.  auto life insurance, may add more during open registration. you get 7.6 hours per pay period of PTO. $25 gift card from company for xmas and employee appreciation day.
cons: PTO is used for vacation, sick and holidays.  not much room for advancement unless you are currently going to school, able to do lateral moves for entry level positions.  which doesn't really get you any where.

pros: Easy to come in as new grad RN - only because they're desperate. Everyone knows this place is only meant to get your experience in
cons: This hospital is stuck in the 80's. Paper charting, no pyxis - you pull medications from a cassette and drawer. Doctors don't put in orders, YOU the RN is expected to input orders for them, no transport team so you push your own bed, no CNAs you are primary RN for the entire shift, charge RNs are new grads with less than a year experience. No cafeteria discounts, Doctors don't speak English and would yell at you if you ask them to repeat themselves. YOU will be stretched thin here. On top of all that? You're getting paid LESS THAN $30 An hour. And this is experienced pay! Working at a SNF pays better than this 'acute' care hospital

pros: The doctors and employees there are very nice to work with. Atmosphere the hospital is nice and clean. Cafeteria food is good. The community loves PIH. I really have not had patient tell me that they don’t love PIH.  The people I have worked with in the past I feel truly care about one another and care about their coworkers being successful .
cons: The parking is getting worse. The cafeteria and coffee shop food prices keep going up. There is no employee discount for food.

review_title: It was a nice place to work until new management team "clique" arrived
pros: Have been able to gain valuable experience and knowledge through the years. Given opportunity for advancement through own initiative. Most employees treat you like family and welcome you.
cons:
If I hadn't taken the initiative, I would not have been given opportunities for growth. 
Some management show favoritism. Others will ignore those employees who are not performing their job duties which affects other employee's productivity.
Cafeteria food selection needs a lot of work.

review_title: Great Pay, horrible Management Group.  Environment is riddled with cliques
pros: The Pay is about it at this point.
cons: Cliques galore.  If you're not in with the "in crowd," you get the worst assignments, you get called out for inconsequential infractions with regularity.   It feels like the mgmt team is simply keeping a log of potential items to use when they think it's time to replace a more senior professional with a lower-paid grad student.   It's all about opportunity cost I suppose.

pros: Steady hours and some great co-workers. Hospital works around school schedules. Good stepping stone for anyone interested in the medical field.
cons: Salaries need to be re-evaluated. Hospital pays below average of Los Angeles County. Management needs to be re-evaluated or replaced. Management is unprofessional and shows favoritism. Lots of Nepotism throughout the organization. Benefits use to be good, they are horrible now. Hospital doesn't invest in their employees, instead they invest in real estate. High turn over rate of employees due to these issues.

review_title: great company benefits, terrible management- pharmacy technician
pros: the company has some really great benefits, pretty good pay, good insurance that isn't too costly, and matching 401k
cons: i worked in the pharmacy and the culture there is toxic. the pharmacy manager is mean and nasty and gets away with treated people badly because she has other people do her dirty work. i was excited to work here and everyone told me i wouldn't be in a couple of months. when i asked why they stuck around they said that the company benefits were worth it, but even then people were looking for other jobs. also if you're new, expect to work the worst shifts ever. you'll work an evening shift on day and graveyard the next.

job_title: Manager of Clinical Pastoral Education in Whittier, CA
pros: PIH Health is a wonderful place to work because of the high quality of the staff who work here.  I have been here for a little over two months and have had very positive experiences across the board with employees from various different departments.  In comparison to the other health systems I have worked in, PIH Health is proving to be one of the best.
cons: The commute is long, but fortunately I am able to take the train, which cuts down travel time from the Inland Empire.

review_title: PIH is not what it seems
job_title: Emergency Financial Representative in Whittier, CA
pros: I believe the doctors and nurses take good care of their patients and I would still come here to get treated if I needed to
cons:
Management team is unprofessional
Bullying between older employees and newbies
Benefits do not compete with other hospitals
Low pay
Work culture feels worse than high school drama

review_title: Not a good place to work
pros: Most of the staff is pleasant, but there are clear favorites in the group.
cons: Expectations from management are simply not based in reality. My group lost 30% of its staff within a 6 month window and we were not allowed to replace them. Simultaneously we kept being assigned more and more work with impossible deadlines and the expectation that everything be vetted and prefect. The organization as a whole is facing a lot of challenges and the pressure and stress is showing.

review_title: Pray your hospital/facility is not bought by this unnecessarily aggresive organization
pros: Medical benefits are great. Buying power when you have a large number of employees.
cons: Aggressive upper management. Unclear goals, unrealistic workloads.

job_title: Senior Claims Examiner in La Puente, CA
pros: Very friendly coworkers with a family feel. Great teamwork and communication amongst employees when it comes to solving problems within the department.
cons: Limited opportunity for advancement within my particular department due mostly in part to the long tenure of nearly everyone working for the company. High turnover in upper management though which leads to frequent changes in department strategies.

pros: PIH Health is a wonderful place to work.  The employees embrace the hospital vision, Patient's First. It is a family environment, where employees are not only there for the patient's, but also each other.  PIH is very supportive of professional development and advancement.  It is a great place to work!
cons: Conitnue to communicate with employees regarding changes.

review_title: RN at Downey - Low pay, always understaffed, doctor-oriented hospital
pros: Good place to learn the trenches of nursing cause it's a low acuity hospital. The ER is basic medical services. After your first year LEAVE!!!
cons: You know you're working for a bad Organization when 90% of the RN staff are new grads. Why is everyone leaving? Cause RNs here get paid what an LVN gets paid at the SNF down the street.  The culture here is so doctor oriented that nurses always get the blame. As if we are not overworked already. nonunion so nurses don't get any protections

pros: RN in the postoperative unit for 2 years and ccu/icu for 2 years.  I left to go to a teaching hospital.  I wish I never left! I miss PIH terribly and they don't take you back once you leave- like a bitter ex! Ample support staff, best equipment, vocera system, good benefits, good pay.
cons: Lunch is 30 minutes- charge nurse usually breaks you.  Lengthy computer charting- no copy paste available. Overtime discouraged.

pros:
The most friendly environment that I have come across as an RN.  Nearly all employees have a great attitude and genuinely care about doing what is best for the patients.  Also, the hospital is great at promoting from within. 


Oh, convenient online classes or classroom style for CEU's through PIH university.
cons: Not many cons, but they no longer have pension plan.  They do offer 401a with matching, and 403B with annual employer contribution.

pros: Stable organization. Majority of nursing staff are great! Salaries are comparable with the community.
cons: Running like a Kaiser. If you're not in the "in group",  forget moving up in the ranks. Positions are posted but frequently the manager knows who they are going to hire ahead of time.

pros: The people are great. Patient care is certainly a focus. I love working here, I just wish it was stable.
cons: The company is unstable right now. There is a lot of change and people, good people, are loosing their jobs. The systems in place are not working. Management has people running in circles trying to meet goals with systems that don't work. The systems in place need to be reconsidered, not the medial record, the interfaces.

pros: Everyone gets along well.  Interdisciplinary attitude throughout the hospital.  Everyone is always looking out for their patients.  I've been a patient here too and all staff I've seen have been awesome!
cons: Staff parking can be a bear but I hear we are getting more parking.  Hope it's soon.

pros: I worked there through a registry and then was employed by PIH. Unit closed in 2004. Many good, caring and friendly nurses.
cons: Management sweeps concerns under the rugs lies. Threatens staff upon investigations from licensing re nurses. Unethical management.  Company out for themselves.

pros: Great coworkers, and self scheduling. Most people that work there do so for many years because it is great to go to work and be almost assured of having a great team around you.
cons: Unorganized system. Paper charting. Very low salaries. Hospital purchased recently and many changes are happening now. However, compared to other facilities, we are essentially in the stone ages.

pros: Met some intelligent people that shared some useful tools that can be handy for the future. Company paid for testing that can be used to enhance profile and pay
cons: Management  is a mess. They are unorganized and cannot keep a consistent and organized workflow throughout. Managers are unable to keep up with their own work load. There is a lack of integrity also as management tries to keep money that do not belong to them. There is a high turnaround of employees including their hardest workers and most loyal ones. They do not keep promises of bonuses or raises

pros: Great support and educational system for new grad RNs. Friendly staff and no egos from management. Higher ups know you by name. Family like culture. The connotation of "nurses eat their young" doesn't apply here.
cons: Hospital still stuck on Paper charting, but i heard that they're transitioning to computerized soon. No pyxis. Pharmacy is slow.

pros: I came to work here because I liked the people I already knew who worked here and the longer I am here the more I appreciate how committed everyone is to caring for our patients and for each other.  It is truly a special place.
cons: Whittier is not freeway close, takes a lot of surface streets to get here

review_title: In a race for last place!
pros: Staff and peers are very friendly. Quality patient care is a priority.
cons: Poor decision making skills by executive leadership who continue to undermine each other's actions. Recent layoffs and turnover drained the organization of morale, knowledge and talent.  Work life balance is not achievable.  CEO is a spin doctor.

job_title: Clinical Medical Assistant in Porterville, CA
pros: Fast paced office serving patients ranging from small children to the elderly, great surgeons with many years of experience..
cons: I was trained & encouraged by the best sr medical assistants/Orthopaedic surgeons in the LA & OC.. No longer a private practice in 2010, we became part of a bigger entity .pih

pros: Great co-workers, nice, updated facility.  Room to grow for some individuals.
cons: This is a very top heavy organization.  Too many senior level employees, while salary increases are minimal, and benefit costs continue to increase.  Employees are feeling the squeeze.

job_title: New Grad Registered Nurse in Whittier, CA
pros: Friendly environment, new grad tranining! Both on hand training and classroom training. Pay is great for a new grad program
cons: Regular employee pay is not very competitive. Ok benefits, not to many cons so far. If the pay after the new grad program was better I would love to stay

pros: There is open communication about the strategy and how employees connect to the strategy.  The transparency is refreshing.  It is easy to have your ideas heard.
cons: Sometimes those who don't want the organization to evolve get in the way.  Organizations must evolve to survive.  We can't stay the same.

pros: Great benefits, friendly environment and the director is fair and amazing.
cons: When it comes to trying to move up the ladder...it is not what you know, but who you know.

pros: Good Staff, Clean Facility, Good Human Resources, Management has been fair and equal to all employees
cons: Need to Hire within before hiring outside. Cafeteria price is unreal, too expensive for employees

pros: 4.67 night differential for LVN. Pay rate based on experience. Good benefits. Work life balance good. They really focus on patient first motto. Great staff. Really work with your schedule.
cons: 4/10 work days. No pension just 403b.

pros: At PIH Health  they really focus on you, That means they work hard to deliver on thier promise of quality, safety and comfort.
cons: volunteers are so helpfull and should get some incentives

review_title: (Foundation Building in Whittier) Great place to work, friendly co-workers and work environment.
job_title: Digital Marketing Intern in Whittier, CA
pros: Everyone was professional and friendly, this was my first time working in an office-type environment and it was an amazing experience.
cons: The internship program was cut from the budget, mainly due to COVID-19.

pros:
The 12 hour shifts.
The cookies and pie.
The gift cards at holiday meals
cons:
Market value pay. I could to another hospital and get paid more.
The health benefits are too expensive.
Very under staffed. No help whatsoever. 
Co-workers pushing other co-workers to the limit. Or their arguing. 
The annual raises. You can buy an ice cream for $1.25. And that's your raise.

pros: Great place to work at. Coordinator is awesome. Very supportive and supportive. Couldn't ask for a better leader to work with
cons: Working with staff that don't want to be there. Some people just work for the money. Take pride in what you do!!!

pros: Highly competitive pay, long-term employment, low stress/performance expectation.
cons: Upper management were promoted through long standing employment with hospital and may not have been qualified to lead in particular, the pharmacy department. Limited foresight on long-term projections  over short term goals.

pros: Pretty well organized. Friendly staff and environment.
cons: Extremely hefty work loads and projects. Can be overwhelming. Not a good work-life balance. Especially how on call schedule and work loads are handled.

review_title: Great place to start as a new grad.
pros: Good culture, good co-worker. Nice RN to patient ratio.  Good night shift differential.
cons: Low pay and raise (1-3% a year). Poor benefit.  Limited opportunity for advancement.  Cutting down benefit and classes more and more.

pros: Big company has a lot of job openings on a regular basis.
cons: Hourly employees are low on the payscale.  Favoritism is apparent in the various departments.  Confidentiality is non-existant. HR sides & goes to bat for management, not the rest of the employees.

pros: Great coworkers and mostly friendly staff who provide awesome teamwork, good place to start off as a new grad RN; up-to-date technology with Vocera systems
cons: RNs float to other units after 1 year experience when unit census drops, pay and benefits are just decent

pros: Great organization, wonderful doctor's staff was good and helpful no matter what if it wasn't your department but needed the help they will be glad to show you.
cons: Their wasn't really any downside to working there I felt everything was great.

review_title: Big hospital no body has heard of
pros: PIH lab is a medium to large lab with a small lab feel with opportunity to grow if you're willing to put in the time.
cons: Organization, staffing, and scheduling in the lab needs to be improved.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Whittier, CA
pros: Positive work environment. Genuinely Care about welfare of patients and keeping up with EBP in nursing. Also very flexible in getting time needed off.
cons: Constantly busy, not enough resources, RNs burned out and over stressed.

pros: Great company, it provides medical benefits, retirement plan.
cons: I wish it would give employees the opportu to grow within the company.

job_title: Licensed Vocational Nurse in Whittier, CA
pros: Flexible schedule doctors are great
cons: Under staffed workload not distributed evenly among workers

review_title: They declared bankruptcy after I was one year there, and they cheated the employees

cons:
Upper management lied and cheated the employees.  They were in bankruptcy too long.
They were behind the times in their business practices

pros: For the most part, the nursing staff work well.
cons: Senior leadership seemed to be tentative without strong sense of accountability and care. I'm surprised that the union hasn't been involved yet.

review_title: Too much ad hoc decision-making because of the conflict between administration, and medical personnel

cons: Too much ad-hoc decision making by management

review_title: PIH Downey doesn't have same wages or benefits that the PIH Whittier does.

cons: Everyone looks the same. Disguise pay cuts by increasing payments for medical benefits and adding deductibles.

review_title: This place is horrible , poor management, CEO lays off people unnecessarily to play monopoly

cons: Poor management who hires friends, then fired good employees and keeps friends of the CEO with no experience , constant favoritism

pros: Helping people, making sure patients have what they need, health wise.

review_title: Horrible place to work- former RD at Nutrition Department
